body: Does this need discussion before a pull is created?
Most of this is invisible in the visual representation, so I think we are good.
These are all good points (except the first one IMHO is not needed, because Syncthing is not a webpage, and the different sections "folders" and "devices" are already there)

Any other a11y issues you've heard of?

Sent from a mobile device.
Please disregard errors as this is a smaller device.

> On Jun 16, 2016, at 16:20, Daniel Harte notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> related #2361
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

Hi,
I'm possibly interested in adding a "devices" region to the devices section.

`<div class="col-md-6">`

I'd probably do something like

`<div class="col-md-6" role="region" aria-label="Devices">`

How can this be translated inside the attribute. I'm not familiar with angular-translate, so sorry for the ignorant question.
I tried:
`"{{'Devices' | translate}}"` and `"{{Devices | translate}}"` neither of which worked, I think because they point at ID's.

@derekriemer not sure if you noticed, but i edited my comment above. there are three other a11y related bugs: #2305 #2361 #2697. I just searched the bug list for 'NVDA' and 'aria'.

To use the translate function on attribute use `"{{'Devices' | translate}}"` with single quotes around the string to be translated, example in `/gui/default/syncthing/usagereport/usageReportModalView.html`

It's not a fancy translator - it just swaps strings based on the language json files at `/gui/default/assets/lang/` 

I'm not sure why this is not working for you as the string 'Devices' is present in these json files.

As to http://www.oaa-accessibility.org/examplep/accordian1/ and best practices for accessibility of tab pannels, we probably should manage focus properly on this list. This is in reference to the advanced settings tab. For now, I'm implementing the easy fixes so you can merge them for the most impact, however I plan to work on this.
Actually this might be easier to fix for an accordion type widget than I thought.

issue.title: Broken aria tags

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
When trying Syncthing 0.11.26, the first screen (http://127.0.0.1:8080/) has these problems:
1. English reports as expanded, when it should default to collapsed since the list is collapsed by default.
   If I expand and collapse it, it reports as expected.
   I think the fix here is to just default to aria-expanded="false", not true.
2. Upon first loading the page, Actions doesn't report as collapsed even though I can expand it. It only gets aria-expanded="false" when I expand and collapse it for the first time.
   That, too, should default to aria-expanded="false".
3. After adding a folder, there's no indication that the folder is expandable. If I press enter on one, I get more info such as the path.

body: Note that this work is almost done. I just have to fix one issue (haven't had Time).
Also, we should discuss setting focus in modals properly, (Some modals don't have focus put in the correct place automatically, and this might require some discussion).

issue.title: minor accessibility fixes #3297

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

This fixes a few accessibility issues, mainly the state of certain controls.
### Testing

Testing in mozilla firefox, Google Chrome, and Internet explorer with the NVDA screen reader have been done. I'm not sure if this project has integration tests.
### Screenshots

This is a GUI change, but the GUI should not visually have changed.
